intro: Hieracium laetevillosum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Hieracium laetevillosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
